(Page 30)
Analysis and Operations Performance There is no expected impact to performance. The required contract modifications will be implemented throughout FY 2023 as contract options funded in FY 2022 expire. Program Change 2 – Classified Program: Description The FY 2023 Budget includes an increase of 30 Positions, 15 FTE, and $\$ 13.30$ to enhance the quantity and quality of financial intelligence products. There is no base for this program. Justification Please reference the classified annex. Performance Please reference the classified annex. Program Change 3 – DHS IE Cybersecurity E.O. Requirements: Description The FY 2023 Budget includes an increase of 3 Positions, 2 FTE, and $\$ 9.8 M$ to mature, detect, identify, prevent, secure, and strengthen the DHS intelligence enterprise (IE) cybersecurity apparatus on the classified TS/SCI network. The base for this program is classified. Justification DHS Cybersecurity is not modernizing at a rate that matches malicious actor capabilities and incremental improvements will not provide the necessary security to meet demand. The prevention, detection, assessment, and remediation of cyber incidents is a top priority and essential to ational and economic security. In response to Presidential Executive Order 14028 - Improving the Nation’s Cybersecurity (May 12, 2021), the additional resources support the initial formation of a measurable unified cybersecurity maturity model to standardize and leverage IE cybersecurity capabilities by implementing a Zero Trust Architecture to achieve specific zero trust security goals by the end of Fiscal Year 2024.

(Page 30)

There is no base for this program. Justification Please reference the classified annex. Performance Please reference the classified annex. Program Change 3 – DHS IE Cybersecurity E.O. Requirements: Description The FY 2023 Budget includes an increase of 3 Positions, 2 FTE, and $\$ 9.8 M$ to mature, detect, identify, prevent, secure, and strengthen the DHS intelligence enterprise (IE) cybersecurity apparatus on the classified TS/SCI network. The base for this program is classified. Justification DHS Cybersecurity is not modernizing at a rate that matches malicious actor capabilities and incremental improvements will not provide the necessary security to meet demand. The prevention, detection, assessment, and remediation of cyber incidents is a top priority and essential to ational and economic security. In response to Presidential Executive Order 14028 - Improving the Nation’s Cybersecurity (May 12, 2021), the additional resources support the initial formation of a measurable unified cybersecurity maturity model to standardize and leverage IE cybersecurity capabilities by implementing a Zero Trust Architecture to achieve specific zero trust security goals by the end of Fiscal Year 2024.

function: Enhance Homeland Security Enterprise with Information Sharing and Dissemination
context:
(Page 31)
tect and respond to cyber events. Integrating the CONMON capabilities with compliance data sources such as GRC, ACAS, Nessus, Core Impact, SCAP, and Microsoft Vulnerability Manager, will ensure an increase in automated reporting of the DHS IE security posture. The additional personnel will ensure asset inventories are reliable through participation in CISA’s Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation (CDM) program. Program Change 4 – Enhance Homeland Security Enterprise with Information Sharing and Dissemination: Description The FY 2023 Budget includes an increase of 30 Positions, 15 FTE, and $\$ 2.7 M$ to support the programmatic aspect of developing and disseminating intelligence to Homeland stakeholders. The base for this program is classified.
